019
020package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.whitespace;
021
022import java.util.Arrays;
023
024import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.DetailAST;
025import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.TokenTypes;
026import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.CommonUtil;
027import com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.utils.TokenUtil;
028
029/**
030 * <p>
031 * Checks the policy on the padding of parentheses; that is whether a space is required
032 * after a left parenthesis and before a right parenthesis, or such spaces are
033 * forbidden. No check occurs at the right parenthesis after an empty for
034 * iterator, at the left parenthesis before an empty for initialization, or at
035 * the right parenthesis of a try-with-resources resource specification where
036 * the last resource variable has a trailing semi-colon.
037 * Use Check <a href="https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#EmptyForIteratorPad">
038 * EmptyForIteratorPad</a> to validate empty for iterators and
039 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#EmptyForInitializerPad">
040 * EmptyForInitializerPad</a> to validate empty for initializers.
041 * Typecasts are also not checked, as there is
042 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/config_whitespace.html#TypecastParenPad">
043 * TypecastParenPad</a> to validate them.
044 * </p>
045 * <ul>
046 * <li>
047 * Property {@code option} - Specify policy on how to pad parentheses.
048 * Default value is {@code nospace}.
049 * </li>
050 * <li>
051 * Property {@code tokens} - tokens to check
052 * Default value is:
053 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#ANNOTATION">
054 * ANNOTATION</a>,
055 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF">
056 * ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF</a>,
057 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#CTOR_CALL">
058 * CTOR_CALL</a>,
059 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#CTOR_DEF">
060 * CTOR_DEF</a>,
061 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#DOT">
062 * DOT</a>,
063 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF">
064 * ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF</a>,
065 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#EXPR">
066 * EXPR</a>,
067 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_CATCH">
068 * LITERAL_CATCH</a>,
069 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_DO">
070 * LITERAL_DO</a>,
071 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_FOR">
072 * LITERAL_FOR</a>,
073 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_IF">
074 * LITERAL_IF</a>,
075 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_NEW">
076 * LITERAL_NEW</a>,
077 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_SWITCH">
078 * LITERAL_SWITCH</a>,
079 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED">
080 * LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED</a>,
081 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LITERAL_WHILE">
082 * LITERAL_WHILE</a>,
083 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#METHOD_CALL">
084 * METHOD_CALL</a>,
085 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#METHOD_DEF">
086 * METHOD_DEF</a>,
087 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#QUESTION">
088 * QUESTION</a>,
089 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION">
090 * RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION</a>,
091 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#SUPER_CTOR_CALL">
092 * SUPER_CTOR_CALL</a>,
093 * <a href="https://checkstyle.org/apidocs/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/TokenTypes.html#LAMBDA">
094 * LAMBDA</a>.
095 * </li>
096 * </ul>
097 * <p>
098 * To configure the check:
099 * </p>
100 * <pre>
101 * &lt;module name=&quot;ParenPad&quot;/&gt;
102 * </pre>
103 * <p>
104 * To configure the check to require spaces for the
105 * parentheses of constructor, method, and super constructor calls:
106 * </p>
107 * <pre>
108 * &lt;module name=&quot;ParenPad&quot;&gt;
109 *   &lt;property name=&quot;tokens&quot; value=&quot;CTOR_CALL, METHOD_CALL,
110 *     SUPER_CTOR_CALL&quot;/&gt;
111 *   &lt;property name=&quot;option&quot; value=&quot;space&quot;/&gt;
112 * &lt;/module&gt;
113 * </pre>
114 * <p>
115 * The following cases not checked:
116 * </p>
117 * <pre>
118 * for ( ; i &lt; j; i++, j--) // no check after left parenthesis
119 * for (Iterator it = xs.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) // no check before right parenthesis
120 * try (Closeable resource = acquire(); ) // no check before right parenthesis
121 * </pre>
122 *
123 * @since 3.0
124 */
125public class ParenPadCheck extends AbstractParenPadCheck {
126
127    /**
128     * The array of Acceptable Tokens.
129     */
130    private final int[] acceptableTokens;
131
132    /**
133     * Initializes and sorts acceptableTokens to make binary search over it possible.
134     */
135    public ParenPadCheck() {
136        acceptableTokens = makeAcceptableTokens();
137        Arrays.sort(acceptableTokens);
138    }
139
140    @Override
141    public int[] getDefaultTokens() {
142        return makeAcceptableTokens();
143    }
144
145    @Override
146    public int[] getAcceptableTokens() {
147        return makeAcceptableTokens();
148    }
149
150    @Override
151    public int[] getRequiredTokens() {
152        return CommonUtil.EMPTY_INT_ARRAY;
153    }
154
155    @Override
156    public void visitToken(DetailAST ast) {
157        switch (ast.getType()) {
158            case TokenTypes.METHOD_CALL:
159                processLeft(ast);
160                processRight(ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN));
161                break;
162            case TokenTypes.DOT:
163            case TokenTypes.EXPR:
164            case TokenTypes.QUESTION:
165                processExpression(ast);
166                break;
167            case TokenTypes.LITERAL_FOR:
168                visitLiteralFor(ast);
169                break;
170            case TokenTypes.ANNOTATION:
171            case TokenTypes.ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF:
172            case TokenTypes.LITERAL_NEW:
173            case TokenTypes.LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED:
174            case TokenTypes.LAMBDA:
175                visitTokenWithOptionalParentheses(ast);
176                break;
177            case TokenTypes.RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION:
178                visitResourceSpecification(ast);
179                break;
180            default:
181                processLeft(ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.LPAREN));
182                processRight(ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN));
183        }
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Checks parens in token which may not contain parens, e.g.
188     * {@link TokenTypes#ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF}, {@link TokenTypes#ANNOTATION}
189     * {@link TokenTypes#LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED}, {@link TokenTypes#LITERAL_NEW} and
190     * {@link TokenTypes#LAMBDA}.
191     * @param ast the token to check.
192     */
193    private void visitTokenWithOptionalParentheses(DetailAST ast) {
194        final DetailAST parenAst = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.LPAREN);
195        if (parenAst != null) {
196            processLeft(parenAst);
197            processRight(ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN));
198        }
199    }
200
201    /**
202     * Checks parens in {@link TokenTypes#RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION}.
203     * @param ast the token to check.
204     */
205    private void visitResourceSpecification(DetailAST ast) {
206        processLeft(ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.LPAREN));
207        final DetailAST rparen = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN);
208        if (!hasPrecedingSemiColon(rparen)) {
209            processRight(rparen);
210        }
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Checks that a token is preceded by a semi-colon.
215     * @param ast the token to check
216     * @return whether a token is preceded by a semi-colon
217     */
218    private static boolean hasPrecedingSemiColon(DetailAST ast) {
219        return ast.getPreviousSibling().getType() == TokenTypes.SEMI;
220    }
221
222    /**
223     * Checks parens in {@link TokenTypes#LITERAL_FOR}.
224     * @param ast the token to check.
225     */
226    private void visitLiteralFor(DetailAST ast) {
227        final DetailAST lparen = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.LPAREN);
228        if (!isPrecedingEmptyForInit(lparen)) {
229            processLeft(lparen);
230        }
231        final DetailAST rparen = ast.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN);
232        if (!isFollowsEmptyForIterator(rparen)) {
233            processRight(rparen);
234        }
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Checks parens inside {@link TokenTypes#EXPR}, {@link TokenTypes#QUESTION}
239     * and {@link TokenTypes#METHOD_CALL}.
240     * @param ast the token to check.
241     */
242    private void processExpression(DetailAST ast) {
243        DetailAST childAst = ast.getFirstChild();
244        while (childAst != null) {
245            if (childAst.getType() == TokenTypes.LPAREN) {
246                processLeft(childAst);
247            }
248            else if (childAst.getType() == TokenTypes.RPAREN && !isInTypecast(childAst)) {
249                processRight(childAst);
250            }
251            else if (!isAcceptableToken(childAst)) {
252                // Traverse all subtree tokens which will never be configured
253                // to be launched in visitToken()
254                processExpression(childAst);
255            }
256            childAst = childAst.getNextSibling();
257        }
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Checks whether AcceptableTokens contains the given ast.
262     * @param ast the token to check.
263     * @return true if the ast is in AcceptableTokens.
264     */
265    private boolean isAcceptableToken(DetailAST ast) {
266        boolean result = false;
267        if (Arrays.binarySearch(acceptableTokens, ast.getType()) >= 0) {
268            result = true;
269        }
270        return result;
271    }
272
273    /**
274     * Returns array of acceptable tokens.
275     * @return acceptableTokens.
276     */
277    private static int[] makeAcceptableTokens() {
278        return new int[] {TokenTypes.ANNOTATION,
279            TokenTypes.ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF,
280            TokenTypes.CTOR_CALL,
281            TokenTypes.CTOR_DEF,
282            TokenTypes.DOT,
283            TokenTypes.ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF,
284            TokenTypes.EXPR,
285            TokenTypes.LITERAL_CATCH,
286            TokenTypes.LITERAL_DO,
287            TokenTypes.LITERAL_FOR,
288            TokenTypes.LITERAL_IF,
289            TokenTypes.LITERAL_NEW,
290            TokenTypes.LITERAL_SWITCH,
291            TokenTypes.LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED,
292            TokenTypes.LITERAL_WHILE,
293            TokenTypes.METHOD_CALL,
294            TokenTypes.METHOD_DEF,
295            TokenTypes.QUESTION,
296            TokenTypes.RESOURCE_SPECIFICATION,
297            TokenTypes.SUPER_CTOR_CALL,
298            TokenTypes.LAMBDA,
299        };
300    }
301
302    /**
303     * Checks whether {@link TokenTypes#RPAREN} is a closing paren
304     * of a {@link TokenTypes#TYPECAST}.
305     * @param ast of a {@link TokenTypes#RPAREN} to check.
306     * @return true if ast is a closing paren of a {@link TokenTypes#TYPECAST}.
307     */
308    private static boolean isInTypecast(DetailAST ast) {
309        boolean result = false;
310        if (ast.getParent().getType() == TokenTypes.TYPECAST) {
311            final DetailAST firstRparen = ast.getParent().findFirstToken(TokenTypes.RPAREN);
312            if (TokenUtil.areOnSameLine(firstRparen, ast)
313                    && firstRparen.getColumnNo() == ast.getColumnNo()) {
314                result = true;
315            }
316        }
317        return result;
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Checks that a token follows an empty for iterator.
322     * @param ast the token to check
323     * @return whether a token follows an empty for iterator
324     */
325    private static boolean isFollowsEmptyForIterator(DetailAST ast) {
326        boolean result = false;
327        final DetailAST parent = ast.getParent();
328        // Only traditional for statements are examined, not for-each statements
329        if (parent.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.FOR_EACH_CLAUSE) == null) {
330            final DetailAST forIterator =
331                parent.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.FOR_ITERATOR);
332            result = !forIterator.hasChildren();
333        }
334        return result;
335    }
336
337    /**
338     * Checks that a token precedes an empty for initializer.
339     * @param ast the token to check
340     * @return whether a token precedes an empty for initializer
341     */
342    private static boolean isPrecedingEmptyForInit(DetailAST ast) {
343        boolean result = false;
344        final DetailAST parent = ast.getParent();
345        // Only traditional for statements are examined, not for-each statements
346        if (parent.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.FOR_EACH_CLAUSE) == null) {
347            final DetailAST forIterator =
348                    parent.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.FOR_INIT);
349            result = !forIterator.hasChildren();
350        }
351        return result;
352    }
353
354}
